intro: Lipochaeta kaenaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Lipochaeta kaenaensis plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a symbol of the unique biodiversity of the region.
